description: Probably borrowed from German Pornokratie, first found in the writings of Austrian-born Biblical scholar Alfred Edersheim (1825–1889), from Ancient Greek πόρνη (pórnē, “female prostitute”) + -κρᾰτῐ́ᾱ (-kratíā, “-cracy”, suffix indicating “government, rule”); analysable as porno- +‎ -cracy.

entries.meaning: (derogatory, often figuratively) A government by, or dominated by, prostitutes or corrupt persons.
(derogatory) A societal culture dominated by pornography.
